tool_description:
Accurate solar system data for everyone

Cerridwen provides geocentric planetary data suitable for a broad spectrum of astronomical and astrological applications, with a focus on our solar system. Among its data you will find, for example, the time of the next sunrise or that of the last full moon, or simply the current tropical position of the sun.
name: Cerridwen Solar System Data
title: Cerridwen Solar System Data

api_list.name: Get data on moon
api_list.description: Like the sun endpoint, but includes a lot more data in the response that only makes sense for the moon.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://community-cerridwen-solar-system-data.p.rapidapi.com/moon"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "community-cerridwen-solar-system-data.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:
import requests

url = "https://community-cerridwen-solar-system-data.p.rapidapi.com/moon"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "community-cerridwen-solar-system-data.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: Get data on sun

optional_parameters.name: date
optional_parameters.description: reference date, in Julian day decimal format (e.g. 238490.123) or an ISO8601 time string supported by astropy.time (e.g. 2014-05-20T23:37:17)
